He unloaded the tv and I willingly took it in the house and made sure there was no cosmetic damage and that it worked properly.  You can't beat that for free shipping, I don't think Best Buy will drop it off at your driveway for free.

Reviews.Title: be careful
Reviews.Author: Adam Renwick "adam"
Reviews.Content: i purchased this tv in july of 2008.  it sat in the box while i was gone, and i finally hooked it up in October 2008.  i've since had to send it to get repaired twice.  once for the power supply and a second time for the board.  everything has been replaced except the sound box and the screen.  luckily it was still under manufacturers warranty.  i had head bad things about deal with samsung customer service, but i had no problems.  i called them up, they gave me a local repair shop and they came out and picked up the TV and fixed it. picture is great on the TV otherwise.  i really like it.  i would recommend buying the extended warranty just in case.  i didn't and now i'm hoping nothing else goes wrong with it

Reviews.Title: Great picture but the audio is below average.
Reviews.Author: C. Shih "Bonecracker"
Reviews.Content: The television picture is great and the options are very user friendly, however the audio is not very good at all. The volume of the audio fluctuates when it goes from a HD channel to a non HD channel. I'm not sure if that is a problem of the TV or Direct TV. Otherwise the TV is very good for the price.

Reviews.Title: I bought two of these!!
Reviews.Author: michelle
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these for a gift to our family. I had been shopping around and this price beat every one else. We couldn't be happier with our new TV's. I was very happy with the delivery. Man brought them in and unpacked them, plugged them in and turned them on. Delivery was great.The Tv's have a wonderful picture. We have surround sound on one and the other just using the speakers on the TV.  I am very happy with my purchase and will not hesitate to buy from Amazon.com. This is my first major purchase from Amazon and it will not be my last.MichelleNaples, fl

Reviews.Title: Expectations met
Reviews.Author: Kapil C. Biswas "KCB"
Reviews.Content: I was glad that the TV was shipped according to Amazon's schedule and on time. The white gloves delivery was impressive. No problem with the tv, I am glad that tv is working fine too.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 52"
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV for the price - picture is fantastic and as good as they get.  Recommend it for anyone looking for a large screen TV.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 52 inch LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Jon A. Forman
Reviews.Content: This TV meets all my expectations. Great picture, easy to set up and easy to use. The sound is good for a TV but any sound buff would want to attach a better system.

Reviews.Title: Great LCD
Reviews.Author: Leonard D. Mcmillan
Reviews.Content: Fantastic LCD. Super picture. Easy to use. Sound Bar sucks, but that is another product to review from Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and more
Reviews.Author: Ortho Engr
Reviews.Content: Am very satisfied with the Samsung 52 inch LCD TV.  the picture is amazing especially in hi-def.  The controls are very intuitive and easy to configure.  and there were plenty of connection options.  i've set it up to use with my laptop (am trying to figure how i can get one for my desk at work!) as well as cable, and DVD players.  The built in sound was just a little tinny and i was dissappointed that there is only one mute level (no soft mute).  also, the RCA plug sound output level is not adjustable by the volume control (can't figure why this is so) but could port the sound out of the headphone jack which does.  but these were relatively minor issues in a set that i am very happy with.

Reviews.Title: Great TV and delivery
Reviews.Author: K. Halloran "bridgenet"
Reviews.Content: Bought 4 LCD TV's this year for Christmas, 3 Samsung and a Sony Bravia.  The LN52A550 was a gift for my parents and had it shipped directly to them.  Delivery was on time for all TV's and had no problems or damage.  CEVA people were great.  Picture on the TV is awesome in HD (Direct TV).  Sound is not the best (no bass), although did not attempt to adjust, just playing it through some old stereo speakers which have great bass.  Price was better than all others, 1 week delivery, and easy tracking.  Great TV.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Picture
Reviews.Author: MAC
Reviews.Content: At first TV did not look very impressive, but when you hook up HDMI cable...VERY NICE!!!  Do not attmept to watch in regular cable mode...must have HD to really appreciate picture quality.  Some blurry motion when watching games in regular mode, but clear picture and better sound when hooked up with HD cables.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 52 inch LN52A550
Reviews.Author: Robert A. Duggan "Bob Duggan"
Reviews.Content: This tv is awesome-do not make the mistake I did at first-use HDMI cable -the picture explodes from the set-brillant colors and almost looks 3D! I have a 42 inch Toshiba Regza which is great but my 46' Mitsubishi Big Screen died after 14 years and I needed a bigger TV for my living room- this TV was perfect! TV showed up in three days in my living room! Amazon by far had the best price.  Looked at the 650 but didn't see the value or appeal for the "touch of red " , 120 HZ or other options. I'm a sports nut and sports are awesome on this set! LCD vs Plasma? Don't see the advantage for plasma and they still have to convince me the life cycle for plasma has improved. Go for it-- you won't be disappointed. Sound not great, but use sound system.  I'm using an old Sony and it works fine---spend more for Bose if you can, or save for the future! Got a Wii for Christmas and it's awesome on this set!

Reviews.Title: A great TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: GoddessofhisWorld "GoddessofhisWorld"
Reviews.Content: I love my new 52 inch Samsung LCD HDTV. The picture is fantastic. I highly recommend this television.

Reviews.Title: Happy with Samsung LN52A550 LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Bud
Reviews.Content: Prior experience with Amazon.Com gave me confidence that my purchase could be safely made. Reviews of comparable products, and pricing helped me choose a model which met my needs, and budget. I am very happy with my experience. Delivery was made on time too!

Reviews.Title: Highly recommended
Reviews.Author: George L. Nagy
Reviews.Content: The TV is easy to set up and operate. The HD image is sharp. A sound bar can enrich the sound and is recommended. The price is reasonable compared to Sony which is comparable in quality.

Reviews.Title: As Expected
Reviews.Author: M. Wells "electronics lover"
Reviews.Content: I say this HD LCD TV is as expected because two months prior to purchasing this 52 inch TV I purchased the Samsung 32 inch TV of the same model number. After installing and using the smaller version I was convinced that the best large screen TV I could buy would be the Samsung of the same model number.I have not been disappointed. The install and connect procedures are simple and easy to follow. The picture is amazing and the controls are so easy to use that my wife can use them. Not to make fun of her ability it is just that she has remote control difficulties.I also purchased the Samsung 1080p upconvert DVD player. It is what they call Anynet. That means that the TV will automatically recognize and connect the player. It is a great function. Absolutly no set up procedure when it is connected.

Reviews.Title: great tv and great price from amazon
Reviews.Author: Ronald Smith
Reviews.Content: great experience all around-got a great tv at a truly unbeatable price-bought 3 samsung sets this month from amazon and the whole process couldnt have been better-this is the only way i will buy electronics (and who knows what else)-am a truly satisfied customer and with the money i saved it was like getting the smaller 22'' tv for free-thank you

Reviews.Title: bad audio
Reviews.Author: Jerald E. Galloway
Reviews.Content: Excelent picture bad audiohad 2 service calls first call repairer said nothing wrong.second came after factoty rep called me, very impressed by factory interest. they replaced some stuff with only a slight improvenment in audio. after checking around it seems all mfgrs like tin can sound and we are stuck with it

Reviews.Title: Stunning!
Reviews.Author: CC
Reviews.Content: An absolutely beautiful television.  The detail and clarity are amazing, the set-up couldn't be simpler, and changing settings and channels on the menu is childsplay.  I received a free Samsung Blu-Ray player (BD1500) with this TV and it works beautifully on all my existing DVDs, even my DVD+Rs.  The HDMI interface between the TV and player is really cool as the TV and Blu-Ray player functionality are highly interlinked with the Samsung "Anynet" functionality.  Cool stuff.  No HDMI cables included, but you don't have to shell out $30-$50 for one.  I went to [...]and got a 1.3 cable for[...].  And the in-house delivery is great too.

Reviews.Title: so glad we got this tv
Reviews.Author: Purchaser
Reviews.Content: we just bought ours and are now enjoying this beautiful tv.  we've had it now for 3 days and the 52" size is just stunning and the picture is awesome.  the shipping process through amazon was painless and the shipment came on time.  probably like you, i was skeptical of buying through the internet such a huge item, but amazon was painless and the tv is fantastic.  great bargain for the price.  i hope that our new samsung tv stays this way (i've read the other reviews!) and that i don't have to find myself dealing with samsung warranty service.  i'm keeping my fingers crossed!  everyone seems to be knocking the speaker quality, but i don't think the speakers are that bad to be honest.  i'm not one of those high-tech type people, so maybe i don't know what i'm missing.  but the speakers on this tv sound fine to me even when i watch dvd movies.  overall i'm happy that we got this tv.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV!!!
Reviews.Author: L. Freeman
Reviews.Content: i brought mine after reading the reviews here and i couldn't be happier...everything you guys said was right on point. i'm glad i opted for this over the 46" 650 model(tooo reflective). i highly recommend this set if you're looking for a 52" LCD with a great picture that's not too expensive.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: D. Norris
Reviews.Content: Got it off of "Amazon's warehouse" deals for $1350 delivered to my front door.  Can't beat that price! I was wary as a friend said most of these TVs on those deals are returns and so I might get a lemon.  Well, it looked to me the remote/manual pkg wasn't even opened so it's possible I got a new set.Anyway, it's waaaay better than my 5 year old Hitachi 720p rear-projection behemoth.  Much slimmer and lighter so I can put it back against the wall.  There's also many more picture adjustment features that you can get off of various audio/visual forums.  Picture is crisp and clear and the sound for so little speakers is awesome.  Haven't bought a Blu-Ray player yet to see what those movies look like on it yet, but I'm sure it's awesome judging from ESPN hi-def broadcasts and XBox360 games.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!!! Samsung ln52a550
Reviews.Author: H. Long
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for 2 months. I wanted to get over the honeymoon phase before I wrote a review. Now this is my first HDTV, so I can't compare to a whole list of other models but it doesn't take a genius to figure out that this TV has a great picture. The whites are very white and the blacks are very black. Having cable TV with HD is amazing. If you set this TV to the right setting I just can't see another TV looking too much better(I found the settings at ATV forums-do a google search). I love watching football in HD. Everything is so clear and, at least for me, I do not see any trailing with the fast moving pictures of football. I don't have a blu-ray yet so I really haven't seen this TV at it's absolute best but I can't wait!If you are debating on this TV or another, I can tell you that you can't go wrong with this one - get the 52 inch - you can never go too big.I didn't see the need to spend the extra $500-600 for the 650 which added another hdmi or 2, the 120hz and the touch of color. That's just my opinion but if you have the extra $ why not. But I love the piano black that surrounds this TV. It's very clean looking.As for the sound I never really listened to it. I have a Harmon-Kardon surround sound hooked up.Overall I can't see this TV being beat and I would definitely recommend this TV!!I did buy the extended 3yr warranty but I haven't had a single problem thus far. The price I paid for the TV - $1800

Reviews.Title: Samsun LN52A550  52 Inch
Reviews.Author: T. Goode
Reviews.Content: Great HDTV - I would recommend buying this TV to anyone.Colors look amazing!Menus are easy to figure out.It is a little slower flipping between stations.

Reviews.Title: Just wondering if it's me or the tv
Reviews.Author: G. DePalma
Reviews.Content: I recently got this tv because I read the reviews on here and thought it sounded like a great tv. I love the size and all...only my problem is the picture quality. I tried adjusting everything on the menu but I still don't get a clear picture. Some of the channels are fine...others aren't. So is it the picture on the other end...or the tv isn't right?? If the picture was crystal clear I'd give it 5 stars. Not sure if I want to return it as it is a large item. So I am somewhat unhappy unless I can adjust it somehow...or maybe when digital comes in Feb. it will be better.

Reviews.Title: Samsung is the way to go!
Reviews.Author: Ryan Endres
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV through Amazon about a month ago and love it. After I made a few adjustments to the picture it was ready to roll with my DISHtv setup.  Super quick white glove delivery.I sit about 11 feet away from the screen and cannot see any artifacts while viewing HD content.  The sound (as others have stated) on the tv is pretty bad.  This is not an issue for me since I always use my home theater setup for sound.This is hands down the best method to buying a TV.  Why go to BB or CC and pay more?

Reviews.Title: Samsung 52" LCD HD
Reviews.Author: Jackie L. Knapp "Jack Knapp"
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be happier with my new Samsung.  Awesome picture, easy to use, very flexible on inputs, etc.  The delivery from Amazon was excellent as well.  The driver set up the TV and removed the packaging...all in all an outstanding experience.

Reviews.Title: Excellent CSR support form Amazon and Ceva
Reviews.Author: JohnFrum
Reviews.Content: I am not an expert on TVs. I did research on Consumer Reports and the Amazon website and other websites. This TV got very high marks.  I also visited other forums to get the proper settings to adjust the audio and video. I think this TV provides excellent performance, but I do have enough experience in televisons to comment on technical issues. We are quite happy with the picture.  I can say that buying this TV was much more pleasant than dealing with Best Buy or Circuit City.  At BB and CC there is so much pressure to buy the extended warranty, overpriced cables, set-up charges etc.  The salespeople at BB and CC might not be on commission, but I know for a FACT that those salespeople who sell the most extended warranties get more hours and more "rewards".  The people at Amazon were easy to deal with and knowledgeable. Delivery was very smooth and hassle free. Very good communication with Ceva, the delivery people.  They were prompt, neat, and a pleasure to work with.  I was initially hesitant to buy a large TV from Amazon, but now I will never hesitate to buy a similar product from Amazon.  The price from Amazon was $400 less than the local CC store, and $200 less than the CC website ( which the local CC was reluctantly willing to match).  No sales tax and no delivery fee saved me another $200.  So I saved $400 right off the top. Combined with the zero pressure and easy delivery and buying from Amazon made a ton of sense.

Reviews.Title: Great 52 Inch HD TV
Reviews.Author: S. Scherer
Reviews.Content: I decided to go with the 550 series because of its value.  It provides a fantastic picture and looks great in any room.  I didn't feel the 650 series was worth the premium after comparing them side by side.Also, don't expect much functionality from the USB port in either the 550, 650, or 750 series, as the TV is very picky about what it will play.Something worth noting, the over-the-air HD tuner is fantastic in this unit and makes for a great viewing experience.  It picks up stations noticeably better than my other HD TV did in the same position.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Eric P. Sloan "Clemsonsloan"
Reviews.Content: Great service, awesome tv for an awesome price.  Will use amazon for all future electronic needs.

Reviews.Title: great tv from samsung
Reviews.Author: Ramon Orquiz Jr.
Reviews.Content: Love this tv , excellent picture, easy menu and good sound. I own a 32inch version and i was so pleased i replaced my 53inch panasonic crt in my living room. I highly recommend this tv for movies ,games and sports. Baseball looks great in HD ,If your very picky football in HD might have a very little blur because of the speed the 120hz helps. You really dont notice it unless you really look for it. If you really picky and dont mind the weight, heat and power usage, look at some plasmas from samsung and panasonic . But if you want a LCD this the best one out their and i am very happy and i am sure you will love it to. Amazon white glove delivery is great is great I have used it before and its great. Best price i could find in town by 400 dollars and no tax or shipping. I hope this helped.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 52a550. . .Great TV! Great Price!
Reviews.Author: Mr. Magoo
Reviews.Content: First, I am not an audio/video expert. So, I did a lot of shopping before I finally pulled the trigger on this one. I went to various retail centers (Best Buy, Fry's, etc.) to scout pricing and viewing performance of the different models.Samsung LCD HDTVs have the best user ratings. The 52a550 is a great buy. It works great in my room, which is a kind of bright. The menu, interface and remote are easy to learn. My NFL Sundays are INCREDIBLE, now I wonder why I waited so long!

Reviews.Title: Save yourself some money, buy this
Reviews.Author: K. E. Maas
Reviews.Content: I was trying to build a home entertainment center with some kind of restraint.  It would have been easy to spend twice as much as I did for a comparable sized TV by going for the 650 or 750 Samsung series.  I ended up getting this TV because I didn't think the 120hz was worth the extra $400-$600 and didn't really think the glossy finish on the higher models would work in a basement used to entertain with lots of lights.  My only worry was that the picture quality would be lower than the newer TVs.  That thought went out the window the second I turned this TV on.I have a PS3 and an HD DVR both hooked up via HDMI.  They both work flawlessly and look gorgeous.  Blu-ray discs look spectacular and with some guidance from the AVSForums I was able to calibrate the TV to get unbelievably accurate color.  Seriously, the 120hz capability to play discs at 24 frames per second and the auto-motion features seem overkill to me.  I have over 400 DVDs and they look fantastic.  People throw around the terms "unwatchable" and "horrible" way too much when they want to justify spending twice the price of this TV for the newest model.The Samsung 5 series may be a bit older, but the quality is still fantastic.  I've never been more happy with an electronics purchase.Only cons:  Do note that if you're getting a TV this large, you better be getting a decent receiver / sound system or at least a home-theatre-in-a-box since the speakers on the TV are pretty low quality, but that's not what you're paying for.

Reviews.Title: Nice HDTV!!!
Reviews.Author: Y. Deng "Robbie Deng"
Reviews.Content: I got this nice piece of HDTV within the scheduled time frame. Picture quality is very good. No concern at all.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV but......
Reviews.Author: An old soldier
Reviews.Content: If you're planning on using the OPTICAL OUT (sound) feature of this television, keep the following statement from Samsung's manual in mind:"When the source is a digital component such as a DVD and is connected to the TV via HDMI, only 2 channel sound will be heard from the Home Theater receiver.If you want to hear 5.1 channel audio, connect the DIGITAL AUDIO OUT (OPTICAL) jack on the DVD player or Cable/Satellite Box directly to an Amplifier or Home Theater, not the TV."also:"The difference between HDMI and DVI is that the HDMI device is smaller in size and has the HDCP (High Bandwidth Digital Copy Protection) coding feature installed." If connecting your computer for playing Blu-Ray, use a HDMI (#2) connection (not DVI).Color brigtness is good but not excellent. For those watching sports, consider Samsung's 600 series (LNA650), which has 120 hz scan frequency. (more expensive, of course)One of the nice features of this television, is you can hook it up to your pc. Just remember to set your computer's scan frequency to 60 hz BEFORE you connect the two.As for the positive remarks concerning this tv-they've already been mentioned in the other reviews. I DO RECOMMEND this tv wholeheartedly, though.

Reviews.Title: great price!
Reviews.Author: Lucy B.
Reviews.Content: Have had this TV about a month and love it. Amazon's price was the best around and the delivery was quick. Company delivering the TV took it out of the box and tested it to make sure it worked before leaving. We paid to have it installed for us and was told we didn't need any additional equipment from our cable company. Not sure if this is true. The channels that broadcast in HD format are incredibly clear. The ones that do not are average but still an improvement over our old TV. We do notice some shadowing on a few channels. Still, would definitely recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: samsung tv 1080p
Reviews.Author: JR  COR
Reviews.Content: The Samsung 52" 1080p  is a really good tv.  I have had it for a month now, and everything looks good and sounds good. When using a blue-ray player the picture quality is great. when just looking at non HD tv shows the picyure looks normal; no big differances can be seen. Overall the tv looks nice and the remote controll is cool.

Reviews.Title: Great product. Can't wait to get my surround sound system
Reviews.Author: M. A. Butler
Reviews.Content: Just got mine and so far I love it. The sound isn't the best but it will do for non-audio files. Can't wait to get surround sound.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Michael R. Zebrun
Reviews.Content: This is a nice TV.  I installed it myself in no time on a TV stand with limited know how.  I went on-line to get different opinions on the TV settings that provide the best sound and picture.  My wife originally thought is was going to be too big for us, but now she thinks it's beautiful.  The TV was great to watch the olympics on.  Movies come in very nice and we don't even have a blueray.  We're very happy with our fist lcd flat panel.

Reviews.Title: Great quality and value
Reviews.Author: RacerX
Reviews.Content: Love it.  It's one of my best purchases this year.  We moved from an older Sony WEGA and were deciding between this and the 46 inch, and between this and the Series 6 (120 hz).We chose this over the Series 6 as we didn't feel the added functionality (for us mostly the 120 hz - reduced blur) justified the price premium (around 500$)We chose the 52 over the 46 as it's more impressive (obviously) and our room is large enough to accommodate the 52, and the price difference was not that high (200)Pros:- Easy to setup and connect with my Digital IO Cable box, Home theater, WII, VCR (yes, still have one)- Great quality.  Colors are vivid, darks are fine.  Go to circuit city and compare with some of the other brands.- Great price- Lots of great reviewsCons (and workarounds):- Sound is not perfect, as everyone notes.I have a home theater, so this isn't a big issue.  Also, as mentioned in other reviews, you can improve the sound by changing sound settings (AVS forums)- Remote is not universal.The remote only controls the TV.  Not ideal, but no biggie.  Just went out and bought a cheap universal remote to control all of my devices.  Don't have all the TV functions on the universal remote, but think there are some fancy ones that may.- PIP is limited(compared with my older Sony)I wanted to have each screen showing a different channel (we have Digital IO, not standard cable), but that's not possible (at least I don't know how).  I was able to set it up so the kids can watch TV on the left screen, while my wife uses WII Fit on the right.Suggestions:- Buy HDMI cables online versus at a local store- If you want PIP to show WII, one way is to connect the WII to a VCR (DVD) route the RF cable from the VCR to the back of the TV.  You can use one of those RF adapters instead.  (The quality may not be as good as the video)

Reviews.Title: My New Samsung
Reviews.Author: Henry Tomasso "Jesus Loves U"
Reviews.Content: I can not be more pleased with my new Samsung TV. From the safe shipping process, too the tv's performance. It's picture is fantastic. It has been wonderful to watch the Yankees in HD on this 52" screen.  The colors are unbelieveable! I am greatful to save so much through Amazon - truly!

Reviews.Title: This is an excellent HDTV for the price.
Reviews.Author: Electronic genius "B"
Reviews.Content: I am extremely pleased with this product. I did lot of searching and I am satisified with stunningly good picture. I am an hard to please guy.

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny !
Reviews.Author: Athma
Reviews.Content: Wanted to get the A650, but the price difference didn't seem worth the feature difference. Very happy with performance so far!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Quality at an even Greater Price
Reviews.Author: Martin Joseph Monet
Reviews.Content: I had been thinking of buying a larger screen LCD TV for about a year but I needed to wait because I bought two 37" TV a year and a half ago for $1,000. each. Then I found this 550 model Samsung at such a great price, I didn't want to pass up this opportunity. The TV is great and I haven't even gotten HD put on it yet. Also I couldn't believe it when the delivery service completely set the TV up for me.

Reviews.Title: SIMPLE REVIEW - Non-Technical
Reviews.Author: Sharon Hagen
Reviews.Content: :-)  :-)  :-)Happy!  Happy! Happy!This TV is hanging over the fireplace and is awesome. It has changed our entire living room.Almost bought the 650, but am glad we settled with a less-glossy screen. Not quite sure I buy the 120Hz hype. We are watching the Olympics now and I don't see anything that needs improvement.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV at a reasonable price---Update!
Reviews.Author: Charles J. Ferraris "video nut"
Reviews.Content: August 8, I left the following review:I purchased this to replace a 48" DLP TV that I couldn't move upstairs, this has an excellent picture, light (for its size) and looks as nice as it functions.  Now I just have to get new equipment to be able to display the 1080p that my old DVD player can't provide.  If I had the need for another, I'd buy it, without the need to look elsewhere.Now it's December 13, and here's my update.  I have had this television for 5 months now and have since added a Samsung HT-Z410T 5.1-Channel 5 Disc Home Theater Surround Sound System (Set of Seven, Black) to compliment it, and with the Anynet+ connectitivity, I am able to load my dvd player, and the TV automatically changes to the HDMI input for the DVD, then when I turn it off, it automatically changes back.  This TV has always had a great picture from day one, and in retrospect, this is by far the best value for a TV.

Reviews.Title: great price, product, and service
Reviews.Author: stemer
Reviews.Content: I ordered this great hdtv on July 30th, had it in my home up and running on august the 4th. kudos Amazon and CEVA!!!

Reviews.Title: The best TV I've ever purchased.
Reviews.Author: K. Cook
Reviews.Content: Holy crap, this TV rocks! I had reservations about ordering via amazon, but the delivery was awesome. the TV is flawless and they have even credited back 116.00 since the price dropped to 17xx.xx after I purchased it. I saved over 600.00 buying from Amazon instead of locally.Check out AVSForum for picture and sound settings.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: M. Lietzke
Reviews.Content: I have nothing to add about the TV that already hasn't been written by another reviewer.  It's a great TV.I will write a little bit about the delivery though,  I ordered my TV from amazon on 7/20 and I got the call from CEVA on 7/28 to schedule delivery.  They would only offer a delivery window of 10-2 on Tuesday or Thursday, and I am not able to sit around at home for 4 hours in the middle of a workday.  So I asked about picking the TV up at their warehouse, and they are extremely flexible about that.  I was told to show up anytime between 8am and 7pm.  The warehouse is just a couple miles from me so that's what I did and it worked out great.  The dock attendant unboxed the TV to show me that it was undamaged, then helped me load it into my vehicle and off I went.  For me, this was far more convenient than me having to wait around to accept the delivery at home.Overall I am very pleased with my purchase from amazon.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: A. DeHart
Reviews.Content: Outstanding product.  I couldn't have asked for a better television/LCD panel.  I've been impressed with it from day one and I'm still impressed.  I'd buy it again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: Perfect HD Television
Reviews.Author: D. Abrams
Reviews.Content: This is my second Samsung HDTV - I also own a rear projection DLP set that I bought about two and a half years ago. This set is superior in all respects but especially in showing non-HD stations and in the quality of the sound. I like the fact that the screen has a matte finish and can't imagine why anyone would spend another $500 more for the top of the line model.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Tolstoy
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV one month back and its excellent. I was looking for 46" TV, but when I found deal on this TV with free Tivo, I got this one and I am not sorry. SD quality is not very good, but HD and movies (not blu-ray) are fantastic, Sound quality is poor, but I am using my owm speakers.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful TV - Best Bang for the Buck
Reviews.Author: M. Winterroth
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV, and a great value. You cannot beat the specs for the price. CEVA's white glove service is a bit lacking (the delivery guys could not wait to unload the TV and leave), but it was delivered with no defects and problems. As mentioned below, I ordered the TV and got the free TiVo, and immediately sold it on eBay for $220. That, coupled with the $75 I just got from Amazon's post price match led to a $1,604 net price. With free delivery and no tax, I could not find a better price for a TV with top specs anywhere else.The sound fix from an earlier reviewer helped things some, but you really need to connect this to a sound system for the total package. With the money I saved, I bought a Sony HTCT-100 soundbar system, and everything works great.Even without the TiVo deal, this TV is a great price. It performs great even in bright rooms, the blacks are deep, and there is no discernible motion blur in HD sports broadcasts. Even standard def channels look quite good, which really surprised me.In all, a great TV for a great price. Just be sure to add a sound system...********* UPDATE 11/17/2009 *********I have had the TV set for a little over a year now, and wouldn't you know it, once the original warranty expired, I started having severe problems with it. I will be watching TV, and then all of a sudden, the screen will scramble, and turn itself off and on again. Sometimes the set will reboot properly, and sometimes it will endlessly click on and off until I pull the power cord. If it reboots properly, the problem will manifest itself again randomly.I have searched the internet, and this does not appear to be an isolated problem. Needless to say, I am quite disappointed in the TV, and now have the added hassle of trying to get it fixed by Samsung...Tread carefully.********* UPDATE 11/19/2009 *********Faith restored. Samsung rep came out and fixed the TV. Even though it was 1.5 months out of warranty, it appears Samsung has a grace period of 3 months to resolve any latent issues. Appears to be working fine once again!

Reviews.Title: Samsung was at the top of its game from 2006-2008
Reviews.Author: G. Denick
Reviews.Content: I purchased this HDTV directly from Amazon in 2008. The video quality is outstanding, with zero blur or SOE ("Soap Opera Effect"), for this was before the foolish gimmick of increased Hz/refresh rate began to be implemented by electronics manufacturers in order to sell more TVs to uninformed consumers who had already purchased HDTVs and should have been, by alll accounts, no longer in that market for such a thing. Bright, vibrant, and crisp, looking at this display is like gazing through a magic window. Call me "old fashioned", but I swear to you, Samsung's monitors from this era are the best to ever be released. I've wondered if perhaps they cut costs on materials and quality in recent years, now that they've already established such a strong reputation, and can coast a bit on the branding effect (not to mention, the market is much more competitive now, and the consumer base has already been saturated with these products, which must make it more difficult to sustain profits).I also have a 40" Samsung that I purchased way back in 2006, and that is still my favorite TV, to this day. Its video quality is unrivaled (better even that this 52"), and its audio is downright unbelievable for an LCD. People often think there is a receiver attached, the sound has so much depth, quality, and clarity. I wish that Samsung had retained that level of excellence in the audio portions of their LCDs, for it's the one thing that this 52" is lacking. The sound on this Samsung is tinny and more typical of what you generally hear in flat panels... it's a shame, because I know Samsung (as well as the other manufacturers) can do better than this... I have the proof in my living room!

Reviews.Title: Not a good TV... Maybe OK TV but HDTV is flawed...
Reviews.Author: G. Schenck
Reviews.Content: Update.  We also purchased a Blue Ray player which, when playing a BR or DVD has a very good image.  At least with BR, we didn't see any pixelization with fast cuts or significant motion so it appears I may have given this TV a bum rap.We use Optimum's IO cable and I even paid for a service call only to be told that this was how the stations broadcast.  I agree with some of the comments here that the problem appears to be caused by the signal quaility from my cable co.  I have to question the whole value of HDTV if the cable companies are unable or unwilling to provide the data volume needed for maintaining a high quality picture.  May of the so called HDTV stations look worse in some ways the our older analog set showed normal stations because, while not as sharp, we didn't get pixelization.That said, if the image doesn't move a lot and it is one of the better stations (they seem to vary as to the quality based on station and to some extent program being broadcast) then the image can be breathtaking.Finally, there is one thing that is the TV's fault.  That is, you can't enable closed captioning when using HDMI cable to connect to your cable box.  This seems really bogus.  I don't need CC but my Mom is partially deaf so we like to turn it on when she visits.Oh well... live and learn! :-)------------------------We recently purchased one of these.  I confess I don't have a lot of experience with HDTV.  This is the first HD set we've purchased.We are very disappointed.The picture quality suffers from a number of issues.  The main problem is that any motion leads to pixalization.  You see this manifest itself in various ways.  Any time a scene changes or a cut in made, parts of the picture becomes pixilated for around 1/2 second before it recovers.  This might be tolerable but certain shows, music videos, etc. that involve lots of short cuts becomes fairly unwatchable.  Certainly NOT as good as a normal CRT TV even though it is hi-def.  Watching sports is painful at best.  Some types of images seem to really cause problems.  For example, if the image has fog or is of water or involves moving lights then it becomes particularly noticeable.  We do have HD programming and so this is not an issue with the signal.In additional to the pixalization, the picture at times suffers from bleeding (movement leaves a smudge or track behind.)  We also get this weird effect where parts of the image seem to move independently of other parts.  For example, if a person is wearing glasses, the glasses seem to bounce slightly up or down or side to side by small but noticeable amounts.  I'm not sure what would cause this, perhaps some aspect of digital compression?I feel let down by the reviews here on Amazon.  The problems we experience are not subtle so I'm mystified as to why the reviews are so overwhelmingly positive.  Buyer beware!If I could return it I would.

While I am not sorry I purchased this set, I am a little disappointed with the picture this set provides when not viewed head on. This can be resolved if the TV is on the base by rotating the TV but it is not possible if wall mounted. Even with an ISF calibrated set-up, the picture does match my previous TV.  Items in some sports programs seem to blur when the camera moves (i.e., the green grass when the camera follows a golf shot). I am told that this is not as effident in the A660 but I can't attest to that. Other than these minor problems I am very satisifed with my purchase - especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: Very few complaints
Reviews.Author: Jordan Brown
Reviews.Content: [ Updated review after about four months ]I'm neither a videophile nor an audiophile, so my review is necessarily limited.  I also don't watch broadcast TV, so I'm only using it as a monitor and speakers for a Blu-Ray player, Wii, PlayStation 2, and a computer.  Most components are routed through a Harman-Kardon AVR247 and thence via HDMI to the TV.  The computer is attached directly via a VGA connector.The TV basically plugged in, turned on, and works fine.  Not a lot to say there.  The picture looks fine, certainly competitive with anything in its class.A few complaints:- The first time I tried to use my Harmony remote to power up the system, it crashed the TV.  Black screen, wouldn't respond to any controls.  Had to unplug it.  This has happened perhaps three times.- Initially, my receiver was out for service, so I was using the TV as a switcher and using its speakers.  It didn't seem to accept the idea of an input with no video, so I couldn't play music from my Squeezebox.- It has discrete codes to select its various inputs, which is what you want if you're using a high-end remote like the Harmony.  However, when it's selected to the VGA input, if the computer is off the monitor goes into a power-saving mode.  When in the power-saving mode, only a few commands will wake it up - not including the discrete input select commands, and not including the discrete power commands.  Oops.  (Worked around this by having the Harmony send the "input select" command first to wake it up.)- The main connectors come straight out the back.  That seems obvious, but when you're talking about an HDMI connector with associated not-very-flexible cable, there's not enough space for a close-to-the-wall mounting.  You'd either have to dig a hole in the wall or add a right-angle connector.  Some competitors have their "back" connectors pointed to the side, both making them easier to get to and avoiding clearance problems for the connectors.- In PC mode the PC didn't automatically detect that the monitor could do 1080p (1920x1080); the best it thought was available was 720p.  However, the PC video driver allowed me to specify my own parameters and I was able to set it to 1080p.- It takes over ten seconds to power up.  That's an eternity when you're waiting for it to power up so that the remote can set it to the right input.[Update 2011-12-27]Still happy.When my AV receiver's video section failed, I tried using the TV's speakers.  We hadn't used them in a long time and hadn't remembered how much better real speakers are.  I think I saw something somewhere about exactly how to set up the TV to get the best quality sound it has; maybe it can be better.[ April 2012 ]It started having trouble turning on - it would turn on, get halfway through its startup melody, and reset.  Only after repeating that for several minutes would it come all the way up, at which point it was fine.  Online research indicated that the problem might be a failed capacitor.  I still had it under extended warranty, so I had a tech come out and, indeed, he pulled the back off and replaced four or so capacitors and it was fine again.  The job was done in perhaps twenty minutes, start to finish.

Reviews.Title: Grandmas dilemma
Reviews.Author: KJD "Legend59"
Reviews.Content: Years ago,when you could walk into Sears and buy an RCA,Zenith or GE tv set,go home and choose between channel 2,4,5,7,9,11,and 13 for Leave it to Beaver,Walter Cronkite,Lawrence Welk or Bonanza....and no manual needed and tv was FREE,it was so simple.There were no YEARLY models like a bumper or tail-light change on an automobile.Now,you choose from 29 different makes,each with 39 different models and a manual an inch thick with writing so small you need a microscope to read it.When it used to be vertical and horizontal adjust with brightness and contrast,it's now aspect ratio,dynamic contrast,usb ports,1080p,umpteen cables and we'll do the dishes for ya!..Ha!....not only that but get cable or dish network and be sure to have rg59 and not rg6 for the digital revolution,get a converter box along with it's remote to go along with the tv remote to go along with the dvd remote...well you get the idea....in the meantime,grandma fell asleep while you fumbled through the remote jungle and Lawrence Welk isn't on again untill next Sunday night!  How's the tv you ask...FANTASTIC!....but the modern age is supposed to be simpler folks and when I walk into a bank and they tell me the computer is down,it's not simpler...they don't have my records available.I still have my money in the bank,I just can't get to it.When the cable tv goes out,I still have my tv but I can't watch it.....and..did anyone say anything about FREE tv?  There are more buttons on three different remotes than you will ever use in a lifetime just to watch the Lakers or Babs.So,to sum up this little review,I still watch 2,4,5,7,9,11,and 13 and grandma can't see the numbers on the remote to change a channel let alone know what CNN is and says,'screw you',she'd rather watch her trusty,rusty Philco with the rabbit ears....I miss the good ole days.  To improve the sound,I did use an old stereo amplifier with 4 speakers to get some theater ambiance and bypassed the tv's nasel stuff up tinny honk and BAM!....it's wonderful.The Lennon sisters sound beautiful and the HD is clear,crisp and Babs looks great!....This stuff isn't exactly user friendly for folks over...well you decide...and do I recommend it?....OH YEAH!...Samsung has got it goin on...I also recommend the good ole days....and simple...grandma wasn't as grouchy.

Reviews.Title: Looks great now!
Reviews.Author: Sankwon Lew
Reviews.Content: Just received the TV.  Phyiscally, it looks gorgeous, and was actually bigger than I expected.  Amazon delivery service was awesome, as they hand delivered to me, and unpackaged it and made sure it worked before they left.I don't have HD setup box so I'm not sure if that is needed, but when I just plugged in my regular cable to the TV, i see standard channells as well as HD channels.  For example, I see CBS on channel 2, but if I go up in the numbers, I see a channel 1-2, which is CBS HD (it says so).CBS HD channel looks better than standard CBS channel.  This leads me to believe that I am getting the HD channel correctly, without the HD Setup Box.  If that is the case, I am quite disappointed with the Quality of picture on these HD Channels on this TV. I have watched HD channels on other TVs, and they looked so much sharper than this TV did.I give it a 3 for now, because I maybe missing something here, but so far, I'm not overly satisfied.------------------------*****8/24 Update*****I got the HD setup box, and I do get HD channels.  However, when I compare the quality of these HD channels with quality of HD channels WITHOUT the HD setup box, there is no difference.  This TV already has a HD-Tuner, so therefore, HD Setup box is not necessary to watch HD channels.  However, you do need them, if you want to watch beyond the standard HD channels.  I took out the setup box, because I only watch the standard channels in HD, and I found setup boxes to be too slow when navigating.Anyway, after watching these channels for couple of months now, I really like them.  I think I had unbelievably higher expectation for the HD channels, and this is not realistic for HD chanels, which only come at 760P.  I have yet to watch blue-ray, which is at 1080p.  FYI, currently Verizon FIOS is the only option if you want full 1080p on your cable TV.
